predictions.text: From 2025-08-18 close to 2025-08-26 close, the U.S. 2-year Treasury yield will move by at least 10 basis points in absolute terms.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use U.S. Treasury 2Y constant maturity (FRED series DGS2). Success if |DGS2 at 2025-08-26 close − DGS2 at 2025-08-18 close| ≥ 0.10 percentage points.
monitoring_signals: CME FedWatch probabilities for Sep/Nov FOMC
Powell/Jackson Hole remarks tone on neutral rate and inflation risk
OIS and Eurodollar/SOFR futures front-end repricing
2Y yield intraday ranges and options skew
predictions.rationale: Jackson Hole often shifts front-end expectations; 2Y is highly sensitive and has frequently moved >10 bps around prior conferences amid elevated uncertainty.

predictions.text: From 2025-08-18 close to 2025-08-29 close, ITB will underperform SPY by at least 2.0 percentage points.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compute returns using closing prices: r_ITB = ITB(2025-08-29)/ITB(2025-08-18)−1; r_SPY = SPY(2025-08-29)/SPY(2025-08-18)−1. Success if (r_ITB − r_SPY) ≤ −0.0200.
monitoring_signals: ITB/SPY relative strength line
10Y UST yield and mortgage rate moves
Jackson Hole rhetoric on policy path
Homebuilder order/cancellation commentary in earnings
predictions.rationale: Homebuilders rallied on peak-rate hopes; Jackson Hole event risk could pressure duration-sensitive trades. ITB has high beta to rates.

predictions.text: The U.S. Core CPI (CPI-U, all items less food and energy) for August 2025 will be 0.2% to 0.3% m/m (seasonally adjusted).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in BLS CPI news release for August 2025, Table 1. Success if the SA m/m change for 'All items less food and energy' equals 0.2% or 0.3%.
monitoring_signals: Cleveland Fed CPI nowcast
Retailer earnings commentary on pricing/promo intensity
Used car auction indices (Manheim)
Rent/OER leading indicators (Zillow, Apartment List)
predictions.rationale: Services stickiness and goods disinflation suggest a 0.2–0.3% core print; retailer commentary points to persistent, but cooling, price pressures.

predictions.text: The Freddie Mac PMMS 30-year fixed mortgage rate for the week ending 2025-09-19 will be at least 10 bps lower than the week ending 2025-08-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare Freddie Mac PMMS weekly averages: PMMS_30y(2025-09-19) ≤ PMMS_30y(2025-08-15) − 0.10 percentage points.
monitoring_signals: 10Y UST yield and MBS current coupon
Primary-secondary mortgage spread
Fed communication at Jackson Hole
Mortgage application trends (MBA)
predictions.rationale: Easing inflation and growth data, plus policy clarity, favor modest rate relief; mortgage rates lag but track the 10-year and MBS spreads.

predictions.text: Between 2025-08-21 and 2025-08-26 (inclusive), the S&P 500 will post at least one daily close-to-close decline of 1.25% or more.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using SPX official close data, compute daily % change. Success if any day in 2025-08-21 through 2025-08-26 has return ≤ −1.25%.
monitoring_signals: VIX term structure into Jackson Hole
Macro calendar surprises (PMIs, claims)
Real yields and dollar moves
Dealer positioning and CTA trend signals
predictions.rationale: Jackson Hole often catalyzes volatility; a single ≥1.25% down day is plausible given rate sensitivity and crowded positioning.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, at least one major U.S. bank (Amex, Chase, Citi, Capital One, or Bank of America) will announce an increased annual fee or a material benefit devaluation on a co-branded airline credit card.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed via issuer press release, official card terms update, SEC filing, or major financial press. Success if a fee increase or clear benefit devaluation (e.g., higher MQD/points thresholds, reduced earning rates) is announced by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Issuer earnings calls/outlook on co-brand economics
Airline partner negotiations and program changes
Competitor card launches or refreshes
Interchange/financing cost trends
predictions.rationale: Airlines are demanding more from banks; rising costs have driven recent fee hikes and devaluations, making additional changes likely.
